lesson.title_and_level: Upper-Intermediate - Saved by the Gong: Math class

sentence.idiomatic: The teacher made me copy out this sentence ten times.
Can you lend me your notes from yesterday's class to copy?
Where is this essay copied from?
The average living space for each person in this city is not even 15 square meters.
What is the formula for calculating the surface area of a square?
The house you want to rent--how much floor space do you need?

word.literal: to be unable to say for certain

sentence.idiomatic: Ask him. Maybe he knows.

word.literal: to be unable to say for certain

sentence.idiomatic: Come and have a look. Who knows, maybe they have things you like.

word.literal: to be unable to say for certain

sentence.idiomatic: It is still uncertain at this point whether or not he will become the champion.
She eats so much every day, and yet stays so slim.
We don't have money, but we have lots of fun just the same.
She doesn't wear brand names, but has a lot of class all the same.
Don't be concerned about the quality, as long as you can get it done it's good enough.

word.literal: to be unable to finish task

sentence.idiomatic: There isn't any news to be found again today, we definitely won't be able to get our work done.
You haven't written one word of your thesis. We'll see what you have to present as your work when the time comes.
Chen Lei, let me copy your math homework, OK? In a little while the teacher is going to check it, and I haven't finished even one of the questions.
No way. The teacher will find out.
The second I see geometry and algebra I get dizzy. Buddy, help me out, will you?
How about this--the parts you don't understand, I can teach you.
OK, how do you calculate the surface area of a triangle?
That's simple, there is a formula. You just need to multiply the base by the height and divide that by two.
What is the answer? I don't feel like calculating it.
Don't you have a calculator? Figure it out for yourself.
That's so stingy. Xu Xiaoting, I can't do my math homework. Teach me how to do it, OK?
All right. Which question?
This one. What is 2 to the power of 4?
You just multiply it and you'll get it.
2 times 4 equals 8. It couldn't be that simple, could it?
What? You should be multiplying the 2 by itself four times.

word.literal: to be unable to come up with

sentence.idiomatic: It would be better if you just told me the answer. Sigh! How can you good students do the questions so easily? I rack my brains and still can't come up with anything.

word.literal: to be unable to say for certain

sentence.idiomatic: Actually you have a clever mind. You just have to be willing to work hard and it's quite possible that your grades could be even better than ours.
All roads lead to Rome. In any case, I don't want to take the studying road. Look at my dad, he's a mess at math, and by speculating in the stock market he makes money all the same.
But now it's the 21st century, you can only make money by having knowledge.
That's not for certain. I've analyzed it before for you guys. Chen Lei, what about you--good at math, you suit becoming a mathmatician. Xu Xiaoting, you suit...
All right already! You had better hurry up and think about your homework not being done and how you're going to get it done.

word.literal: to speculate in the stock market
